Customize a Weighting Strategy¶

Here we would like to introduce how to customize a new weighting strategy with the support of LibMTL.

Create a New Weighting Class¶

Firstly, you need to create a new weighting class by inheriting class LibMTL.weighting.AbsWeighting.

from LibMTL.weighting import AbsWeighting

class NewWeighting(AbsWeighting):
    def __init__(self):
        super(NewWeighting, self).__init__()

Rewrite Corresponding Methods¶

There are four important function in LibMTL.weighting.AbsWeighting. We will introduce them in detail as follows.

  • backward(): The main function of a weighting strategy its input and output format can be found in LibMTL.weighting.AbsWeighting.backward(). To rewrite this function, you need to consider the case of multi-input and multi-label (refer to here) and the case of rep-grad and param-grad (refer to here) if you would like to combine your weighting method with more architectures or apply your method to more datasets.

  • init_param(): This function is used to define and initialize some trainable parameters. It does nothing by default and can be rewritten if necessary.

  • _get_grads(): This function is used to return the gradients of representations or shared parameters (covering the case of rep-grad and param-grad).

  • _backward_new_grads(): This function is used to reset the gradients and make a backward (covering the case of rep-grad and param-grad).

The _get_grads() and _backward_new_grads() functions are very useful to rewrite the backward() function and you can find more details about them in here.
